ResourceHeader.ResourceName: Polar Plasma Wave Instrument HFWR Interferometry Data
ResourceHeader.Description: This set of plasma waves in the Earth's polar regions comes the high-frequency waveform receiver (HFWR) of the Polar Plasma Wave Instrument (PWI), in which two of the six channels between 20 Hz and 25 kHz are connected to the Ev+ and Ev- antennas to allow digitization of the single-ended waveform. The data come in snapshots of 190902 points distributed among 2 to 6 channels every 9.2 seconds, where the duration of the snapshot is 0.045 seconds. Since Epoch time is in milliseconds, the times for the data points will not be unique unless the Delta_T (in milliseconds) is added to the Epoch time for the snapshot.

AccessURL.Name: in CDF via ftp from CDAWeb
